item.title: Access your kubernetes service from anywhere using Tailscale
item.description: I recently setup a local kubernetes in my home network to play with and one of the issues that I faced is that it is hard to access the services inside the cluster from my laptop. I don’t have a load-balancer setup in my setup so everytime I want to access a service from laptop, I’ll have to run kubectl port-forward. It works but it’s annoying. Usually, in cloud environments like AWS you would setup an ingress-controller that will provision a load balancer for you and use that load balancer to expose your services inside the cluster to the internet using Ingress resources.
